metadata.Description: A gas turbine is a type of internal combustion engine that converts the energy from the combustion of a fuel, such as natural gas or liquid fuels, into mechanical energy.

entities.Description: Markets where electricity, natural gas, and other energy commodities are bought and sold.
Energy democracy is a concept that promotes the democratization of energy systems, giving communities and individuals more control over the production, distribution, and consumption of energy.
The use of less energy to provide the same level of output or service, resulting in reduced energy consumption, cost savings, and environmental benefits.
The process of capturing and storing energy for later use.
Renewable energy certificates, also known as green certificates or tradable renewable certificates, are proof that a certain amount of electricity has been generated from renewable sources.
A gas turbine is a type of internal combustion engine that converts the energy from the combustion of a fuel, such as natural gas or liquid fuels, into mechanical energy.

relations.Subject: energy storage
relations.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.

relations.Subject: energy markets
relations.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

relations.Subject: energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.
The combustion chamber is a crucial component of a gas turbine. It is where the fuel and air mixture is ignited and burned, generating high-temperature and high-pressure gases that drive the turbine.
relations.Subject: combustion chamber

relations.Description: The compressor is an essential part of a gas turbine. It compresses the incoming air, increasing its pressure and temperature before it enters the combustion chamber. This compressed air is necessary for efficient combustion and power generation.
relations.Subject: compressor

relations.Description: The turbine is a key component of a gas turbine. It consists of a series of blades mounted on a shaft. As the high-temperature and high-pressure gases from the combustion chamber flow over the turbine blades, they cause the blades to rotate, converting the gas energy into mechanical energy.
relations.Subject: turbine

relations.Description: The generator is an integral part of a gas turbine system. It is connected to the turbine shaft and converts the mechanical energy from the turbine into electrical energy. The generator plays a crucial role in the power generation process.
relations.Subject: generator

relations.Description: The exhaust system is an important component of a gas turbine. It is responsible for safely removing the exhaust gases from the turbine after they have passed through the turbine blades. The exhaust system also plays a role in controlling emissions and ensuring environmental sustainability.
relations.Subject: exhaust system
